get.summary: Returns all Data to Server Collections configurations

post.summary: Creates a new Data to Server Collection configuration

put.summary: Updates the selected Data to Server Collections configurations

delete.summary: Deletes the selected Data to Server Collections configurations

get.summary: Returns the specified Data to Server Collection configuration

put.summary: Updates the specified Data to Server Collection configuration

delete.summary: Deletes the specified Data to Server configuration

get.summary: Returns Data to Server all available data plugin names, description and tags

post.summary: Creates a new Data to Server Data Plugin configuration

get.summary: Returns all Data to Server Data Plugins configuration

put.summary: Updates the selected Data to Server Data Plugins configurations

delete.summary: Deletes the selected Data to Server Plugins configurations

get.summary: Returns the specified Data to Server Data Plugin configuration

post.summary: Uploads the Data Plugin necessary files

option.description: Parameter to upload the file to.

put.summary: Updates the selected Data to Server Data Plugins configurations

delete.summary: Deletes the specified Data to Server Data Plugins configurations

get.summary: Returns Data to Server all available Server Plugin names, description and tags
Returns all Data to Server Server Plugins configuration

put.summary: Updates the selected Data to Server Server Plugins configurations

get.summary: Returns the specified Data to Server Server Plugin configuration

post.summary: Uploads the Server Plugin necessary files

option.description: Parameter to upload the file to.

put.summary: Updates the specified Data to Server Server Plugin configuration

description.description: A concise explanation of the plugin's functionality.

solo_collection.description: Indicates whether a collection can have only one plugin of this type (true), thus prohibiting multiple plugins of the same type within a single collection.

enabled.description: Check to enable this Data to Server.

name.description: Name of the Data to Server. Used for easier Data to Servers management purposes only.

na_str.description: A string which will be placed if any value cannot be received.

period.description: Interval in seconds for collecting/sending data to destination.

retry.description: In case of a failed attempt, retry to send the same data to destination later.

retry_count.description: Retry to send the same data N times.

retry_timeout.description: Timeout in second between retry attempts.

mqtt_in_psk.description: The pre-shared-key in hex format with no leading “0x”
Indicates if 'mqtt_in_psk' option is set. 'unset' for not set, 'set' for configured.

mqtt_in_password.description: Indicates if 'mqtt_in_password' option is set. 'unset' for not set, 'set' for configured.

na_str.description: A string which will be placed if any value cannot be received.

delimiter.description: Specifies delimiters for multiple data segments.

bl_filter_mac.description: Filter data by device MAC address.

bl_object.description: Format segment as object and not as array element

modbus_alarm_filter_server_id.description: Filter data by defined server ID.

modbus_filter_alarm_id.description: Filter data by defined alarm ID.

modbus_alarm_filter_register.description: Filter data by Modbus register number of alarm.

modbus_filter_server_id.description: Filter data by defined server ID.

modbus_filter_server_ip.description: Filter data by defined server IP address.

modbus_object.description: Format segment as object and not as array element.

dnp3_filter_address.description: Filter data by defined DNP3 address.

dnp3_filter_ip.description: Filter data by defined IP address.

dnp3_object.description: Format segment as object and not as array element.

mbus_filter_name.description: Filter data by defined M-Bus record name

mbus_object.description: Format segment as object and not as array element.

opcua_filter_name.description: Filter data by defined OPC UA value group name.

opcua_object.description: Format segment as object and not as array element.

wifi_filter_mac.description: Filter data by device MAC address.

wifi_object.description: Format segment as object and not as array element.

mqtt_in_host.description: Host address or IP address of MQTT broker to connect to.

mqtt_in_client_id.description: Client ID to send with the data.

mqtt_in_qos.description: MQTT Quality of Service. Allowed values: 0 - when we prefer that the message will not arrive at all rather than arrive twice, 1 - when we want the message to arrive at least once but don't care if it arrives twice or more, 2 - when we want the message to arrive exactly once. A higher QoS value means a slower transfer.

dlms_filter_name.description: Filter data by defined DLMS record name.

dlms_object.description: Format segment as object and not as array element.

http_header.description: Allows to add custom headers to the HTTP requests.

mqtt_host.description: Hostname or ip address of the broker to connect to.

mqtt_topic.description: MQTT topic to be used for publishing the data.

mqtt_client_id.description: Client ID to send with the data.

mqtt_qos.description: MQTT Quality of Service. Allowed values: 0 - when we prefer that the message will not arrive at all rather than arrive twice, 1 - when we want the message to arrive at least once but don't care if it arrives twice or more, 2 - when we want the message to arrive exactly once. A higher QoS value means a slower transfer.

mqtt_psk.description: The pre-shared-key in hex format with no leading “0x”.

mqtt_use_credentials.description: Enables use of username and password for authentication.

azure_connection_type.description: Select the attestation method to connect to Azure IoT Cloud

azure_connection_string.description: onnection string based on primary key used in API calls which allows device to communicate with IoT Hub.

azure_id_scope.description: Unique identifier that is assigned to an Azure IoT Hub during its creation and is used to uniquely identify the specific provisioning service the device will register through

azure_registration_id.description: The registration ID is used to uniquely identify a device registration with the Device Provisioning Service. Registration ID is the X.509 certificate common name (CN) field of the individual device's certificate

azure_global_prov_uri.description: Destination for messages sent by IoT devices to the Azure IoT Hub (will default to global.azure-devices-provisioning.net if not set)
